div.l: I praye you spede vs heme in that ye maye
¶ It shall be do quod symkyn by my fay
What wyll ye do whyles it is in honde
By god ryght by the holper woll I stonde
Quod Iohn and se how the corn goos in
Yet sawe I neuer by my fader kyn
How the hopper waggys to and fro
¶ Aleyn answerd Iohn wylt thou so
Then woll I be byneth by my crowne
And se how the mele fallys downe
In to the trough that shall be my disport
For Iohn in fayth I may be of your sort
I is as ylle a myllare as is ye
¶ The myllar smyled of her nycete
And thought all this is don but for a wyle
They wene that no man maye hem begyle
But by my thryfte yet shall I blere her eye
For al her sleyghte and her phylosophye
The more queynte crekys that they make
The more shall I stele whan I take
In stede of flouur yet woll I yeue hem bren
The grettest clerkes be not the wysest men
As whylom to the wulf thus spak the mare
Of alle her art ne counte I not a tare
¶ Out at the dore he goth full preuely
Whan that he sawe his tyme softly
He lokyth vp and downe tyll he hath founde
Thyse clerkes hors where it stode y bounde
Behynde the mylle vnder a leefsell
And to the hors he goth fayr and well
He strypeth of the brydyll ryght anon
¶ And whan the hors was loos he gan to gon
Toward the fenne where wylde marys renne
Forth wyth wehy thrugh thycke and thynne
This myllar goth ayen no worde he sayde
But doth his note ⁊and wyth the clerkes playde
Tyll that her corn was fayr and wel grounde
And whan the mele is sackyd and bounde
This Iohn goth forth ⁊and fynt her hors awaye
And gan to crye harrow and well awaye
Our hors is lost aleyn by cockys banys
Stepe on thy fete come of man alle at anys
Alas our wardeyn hath his palfraye lorn
¶ This aleyn all forgate both mele and corn
All was out of mynde his husbondrye
What whylke waye is he gon he gan crye
¶ The wyf came rennyng Inward at a renne
She sayd allas your hors gooth to fenue
Wyth wylde marys / as faste as he may go
Vnthanke come on his honde þᵗat bond hym so
And he that better sholde haue knyt the reyne
¶ Alas quod Iohn alas for crystis peyne
Ley downe thy swerde and I woll myn alswa
I is full swyfte / god wote as is a raa
By goddys sale he shall not escape vs bathe
Why ne had thou put the capyll in the lathe
Ille hayll by god aleyn thou is a fonne
¶ Thyse sely clerkes haue well fast y ronne
Toward the fenne hothe aleyn and eke Iohn
And whan the myllar sawe they were goon
He half a busshell of her flowur hath take
And bad his wyf go knede it in a cake
He sayd I trowe the clerkes were a ferde
Yet can a myllar make a clerkes berde
For all her art yet lete hem goo her waye
Lo where he gon so lete the chyldren playe
They get hym nought so lyȝtly by my crowne
Thyse sely clerkes rennen vp and downe
Wyth kepe kepe stonde stond Iossa ware derere
Gea whystle þᵘou thare and I shall kepe hȳm here
But shortly tyll it was veryly nyght
They cowde not thouȝ they dyde all her myȝt
Her capyll catche he ranne alwaye so faste
Tyll in a dyche they caughte hym at the laste
¶ Wery and wete as best is in the rayn
Comyth Iohn þᵉ clerke ⁊and wyth hȳm came aleyn
Alas quod Iohn the daye that I was born
Now are we dryuen to hethynge and to scorn
Our corn is stole men wyll vs foles calle
Bothe the wardeyn and our felowes alle
And namely the myllar wel a waye
Thus playneth Iohn as he goth by the waye
Towarde the mylle and bayarde in his honde
¶ The myllar syttynge by the fyre he fonde
For it was nyght ⁊and ferther myght they nought
But for the loue of god they hym besought
Of herborugh and of ese as for her peny
The myllar sayd agayn yf ther be ony
Suche as it is yet shall ye haue your part
Myn hous is streyght but ye haue lernyd art
